messages.title: A MESSAGE FROM DAVID JONES
messages.content:
This is the most important general election of any of our lifetimes. In June 2016, the people of this country voted by a clear majority to leave the European Union. Parliament had the duty to follow instructions it received from the people, but failed to do so. That is why we are having an election now. We need to get Brexit done, a new Parliament that respects the people, and get on with the job of governing the country.
I know from speaking to the people of Clwyd West that, when we get Brexit finished, this is what will happen. Only the Conservatives will do that.
I have represented the people of this constituency at Westminster since 2005. I live in the heart of Clwyd West. My continued local access has always been important to me.
You vote for me will help ensure that, after Brexit, Clwyd West will continue to have a strong, effective local MP for years to come.

politicalExperience.role: Minister of State at the Department for Exiting the European Union
Welsh Affairs, Public Administration and European Scrutiny committees

personalStories.story: David is a local person, having lived in this area since 1977. Born in London of Welsh parents, David was brought up in the Wrexham area. After being educated at Ruabon Grammar School, he began his working life at the former British Steel Corporation plant in Shotton, on Deeside. He went on to become a partner in a legal practice in Bangor, before establishing a solicitor's practice in Llandudno.
